SEARCH
Package hms.repository

Interface IUserRepository<E extends User>

Type Parameters:
E - the type of User that the repository manages
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdministratorRepository, DoctorRepository, PatientRepository, PharmacistRepository, ReceptionistRepository
public interface IUserRepository<E extends User>
This interface defines the contract for repositories that manage User entities. It provides methods for common operations like retrieving, removing, and serializing user data. The generic type parameter E represents the type of User managed by the repository (e.g., Doctor, Patient).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    deserialize()
    Deserializes the user data and writes it to a persistent storage (e.g., file or database).
    List<E>
    getAll()
    Retrieves all users in the repository.
    E
    getById(String id)
    Retrieves a user by their unique identifier.
    Map<String,E>
    getMap()
    Retrieves the map of users, with user IDs as the keys.
    void
    removeById(String id)
    Removes a user by their unique identifier.

  • Method Details

    • getById

      E getById(String id)
      Retrieves a user by their unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the user
      Returns:
      the user with the given ID, or null if no such user exists

    • removeById

      void removeById(String id)
      Removes a user by their unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the user to be removed

    • getAll

      List<E> getAll()
      Retrieves all users in the repository.
      Returns:
      a list of all users in the repository

    • getMap

      Map<String,E> getMap()
      Retrieves the map of users, with user IDs as the keys.
      Returns:
      a map where the key is the user ID and the value is the corresponding user

    • deserialize

      void deserialize()
      Deserializes the user data and writes it to a persistent storage (e.g., file or database). This method is used for serializing the user entities, typically into a CSV or database format.
